intro: Zygophyllum densiflorum, commonly known as the denseflower zygophyllum, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with features such as succulent stems and reduced leaf size to minimize water loss. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Zygophyllum densiflorum plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small animals in its native range.
